subject: RE: [junit] More info for "Could not invoke the suite() method" e rror
msgSnippet: I did exactly the same thing.  It definitely helps debug start-up problems. In general, I think a -debug flag that enabled/disabled this sort of
messageBody:
I did exactly the same thing. It definitely helps debug start-up problems.
In general, I think a -debug flag that enabled/disabled this sort of
logging/tracing would be helpful.

Scott Stirling
JRun QA, Macromedia
www.macromedia.com

-----Original Message-----
From: pspitz@... [mailto:pspitz@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 29, 2001 4:34 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] More info for "Could not invoke the suite() method"
error


I'm not sure if this is the right place to post this suggestion for a
future feature of JUnit. I hope so.

I think adding the following two lines to the "getTest" method of
the "BaseTestRunner" class would save people a lot of debugging time.

System.out.println(e.toString());
e.printStackTrace();

They would go right after the line with "Could not invoke the suite()
method".

I made the change to my copy of JUnit and it pointed me right to a
classpath problem (after spending at least an hour guessing at what
was wrong).

However, as soon as the new version of JUnit is available, I'll lose
the change. It's not hard to redo but I don't want to forget.

Thanks,
Peter
